title: Defiantly the best outside
text:
Defiantly the best outside of Asia, I had a fantastic lunch.

It was my first time visiting so the lady that took me to the table told me all about the history and stoped by the window to the kitchen to tell me how the dumplings are made.

She gave me a seat by the window so I could watch the chefs and she made some fantastic recommendations for what to try.

It was so hard to choose that I probably over-ordered but it was all so tasty that I ate everything.

I can’t stop thinking about the salted egg custard bun and the mushroom dumplings!

I really can’t wait to go back to London so I can eat here again!!!!

title: Perfection
text:
If I could only use one word to review this hotel then it would be perfection.

We visited for the first time a few months ago to try their Sunday lunch and was so impressed that we booked two nights in the Master Suite for my birthday.

Our stay was flawless, everything was just right.

The staff are attentive and professional, always there to help and provide a high standard of service. We could not work out how to turn down the radiator and someone came up straight away to assist.

The lounge area is delightful, it’s like being in a stately home. It’s warm and relaxing and we enjoyed spending time by the log burner or by the windows overlooking the gardens with coffee and newspapers.

Our room was luxurious, with a massive four poster bed, smart TV and a jacuzzi bath. The bed was very comfortable, with good quality bedding. The room was clean and fresh and I loved the toiletries that were provided, we ended up buying some hand-wash to take home. It was fun enjoying a jacuzzi bath whilst watching Netflix.

The estate is well kept and we had a very enjoyable walk around the grounds. Even though it’s November it was still a very beautiful place to walk and was kept tidy.

The food is exceptional and the restaurant is my new favourite place to eat in Wales. The dishes are imaginative and luxurious. The pastries and sources were particularly magnificent. The quality of ingredients is very high and it represents good value for what you get. The service is exceptional, very attentive and professional. I want to go back and try their afternoon tea as the baked goods that I had were excellent.

They had a good choice at breakfast and again the food was of a high quality.

We booked to use the pool and outdoor hot tub. You book in 30 minute slots and share the pool with one other couple but have the hot tub to yourself. It’s a good size pool and the temperature is just right (sometimes I find pools to be too cold). I really enjoyed the hot tub, it’s on a balcony outside so you can lay back and watch birds of pray circling above you. They have a steam room and sauna but it’s out of use due to COVID

I also booked a full body massage, which was very relaxing. I liked the fact that you are given a form to notify them of how firm you want the massage and weather you want silence or conversation.

I can’t recommend this hotel, spa and restaurant highly enough, we had a perfect stay and I can’t wait to go back

title: Magic
text:
I was not sure if the experience would live up to the hype since it’s a big hit with the Instagram influencers - but it dose live up to its reputation

I was impressed with their COVID safety measures and had my temperature taken on arrival.

I love how they combine modern elements like the Shrigley prints, space egg toilets and their imaginative take on afternoon tea, with classic silver service and live classical music.

The menu is very creative and truly magical. Every dish was truly perfect.

title: Best burger
text:
Stoped off for lunch after a local walk and had one of the best burgers I’ve ever had.

The burger was well seasoned and good quality tasty meat.

The chips were perfect and I loved the sweet gherkins

Can’t wait till it reopens so I can have another!

title: Lovely visit
text:
We were staying in a hotel down the road so piped in for a quick visit.

We had an informative and enjoyable tour of the house, which was done well to ensure social distancing

We did not have much time to enjoy the grounds but what we saw looked impressive

title: Stylish stay
text:
This was a very unique experience which I throughly enjoyed. I stayed in the horse-box, which was very stylish and unusual. The room has been well thought out and it was such a pleasure to be a guest in this room.

I loved the concept of the room, which has kept many original features from the stables. Words can’t describe how stunning the room is so I have taken some photos. The bath is amazing, it must be about three times larger than a normal bath! It was so relaxing and designed to look like a horse trough.They had very nice toiletries and supplied slippers and robes.

Due to COVID there are some changes to how they normally operate so you get a useful disposable information pack on arrival.

Due to the size, the bar is closed so they give you a bar menu and if you want any drinks you just need to call reception and they will deliver to your room (no additional charge for room service). The price of the drinks was very reasonable.

You are also given the choice to have breakfast in your room or in the restaurant. You need to order the night before, which is something I have found quite a few hotels ask for due to COVID. I decided to have the veggie breakfast, I’m not vegetarian but it sounded really good. The veggie breakfast came with fried potatoes and Glamorgan sausage, which was fabulous. My husband had the traditional cooked breakfast and was impressed with the quality of the sausage and bacon and was also impressed with how well the bacon was cooked, as sometimes it can be overdone and hard.

It’s been mentioned in other reviews that that they use packet salt/pepper, however this is due to COVID and many places give packet condiments as this is safer. Also mentioned in other reviews is the fact that they have a marquee, again I would think this is due to COVID as many places have put these up to assist with outdoor dining as there have been times where pubs and restaurants can only operate outside. For me personally, I find it reassuring that they are taking infection control seriously.

We had dinner in the hotel Bistro, which is a nice cosy place to eat. I think it’s probably a reduced menu due to COVID, like many other hotels at the moment. There are classics like burger, fish & chips and fish pie, alongside a daily specials menu. The quality of food was good and we felt the meal to be good value at around £77 for three courses and wine. They had a good selection of wine by the glass. The waitresses were professional and friendly.

The receptionist was very helpful, we arrived a few hours early for check-in so she recommended some local places to visit and had an enjoyable few hours hours Narberth village.

The hotel is set in a fantastic location, the estate is very picturesque. Down the road is a charming castle, which is worth a trip.

Good tray selection in the room with Welsh cakes on arrival and water by the beds.

We had a quite nights sleep and the bed was very comfortable. The room was very clean and airy. It’s a big room so was a little chilly when we arrived in hindsight I should have called reception and asked for a portable heater.

There was a large TV however we struggled to get it to work. The WiFi signal was weak, however as someone that lives in rural Brecon, I understand that this is probably something that is outside the control of the hotel as more rural locations can often struggle to get a reliable service. With such a stunning location it was no hardship for us to be without a TV or internet for the night.

title: Rip off
text:
Very expensive and not worth it, also lots of additional costs when you get there.

I feel the ticket price is too high and once you get there you have to pay for lots of extras. The car park is an additional £6 and you also have to pay more for the dungeon and archery.

There was not much to see once you were in the grounds -Caerphilly castle is only £8 an adult or £22 for a family and is just as good.

I was disappointed that there was not much information on the history of the Castle.

There were a few things that were included in the ticket price but the lines were long and people were not 2m apart so did not bother.

Quite a bit seems to be closed, which is understandable but it just seemed like an expensive day out.

They also seem to use a lot of tactics to put pressure on parents to spend more money, for example you have to exit by going through the gift shop

title: Truly perfect
text:
We had a truly perfect experience, this is one of the best places I have eaten.

They take COVID precautions seriously and checked when we arrived that we did not have symptoms

The Champaign cocktail was well made and the wine very good

To start we had the Stilton soufflé which was excellently done. It was well thought out and the flavours of each part of the dish was complimentary.

We ordered the beef wellington for our main and it was perfect.

The staff were wonderful

We had a perfect evening

title: Amazing
text:
Stoped off for Sunday lunch and it was fantastic, we really want to come back and try the a la carte menu

On arrival staff checked our temperatures and gave us hot flannels and sanitiser. I am impressed with the COVID safety measures

The service was perfect

The food was stunning, one of the best Sunday lunches I’ve ever had

Look forward to coming back

title: Fantastic
text:
Had a great experience, arrived an hour early and they were more than happy to accommodate us.

The punter (no idea if that’s what they are called) was fantastic, very knowable and had a great manner.

You get to see some amazing sights and it’s a fabulous way to see Cambridge

title: Not as good as I expected
text:
I really love the concept of building your own dinner but in all honesty this was not the best fish and chips.

Had the tempura batter but it was not really like tempura and was very hard. My husbands beer batter was also hard.

It’s trendy but the food was not as good as my local chippy.

Also I felt that the tables were too close for social distancing and it made me feel uncomfortable. I’m sure it’s all as it should be but i felt that people were too close to me

title: Wonderful
text:
Fantastic food, such great quality and also good wine.

The service is attentive and friendly and the atmosphere is perfect.

We had a truly wonderful gastro pub meal.

title: Very enjoyable
text:
Had a very enjoyable time. It’s a very attractive pub with lots of history.

Service was prompt and offered decent pub food.

title: Poor
text:
Staff were good and the hotel is in a great location but they are the only positives. It really needs someone to check the rooms and put them right

I booked a Privilege Room and quite honestly it was shocking. I hate to think what the standard rooms are like!

I don’t normally give bad reviews but this is a hotel that I would definitely never stay in again. For the first time ever we seriously considered checking out and finding a different hotel.

The room is very tired and the furniture needs replacing. The wood on the top of the desk is chipped and the varnish is peeling off. The chairs were stained and threadbare.

There were stains on the curtains and one curtain had come off the rail.

The walls were also stained and dirty.

The light firing was burnt and wonky

The bathroom needs replacing, there were no covers on the taps. The towels were thin and some were dirty.

You can hear traffic from outside but luckily the road was not too busy.

One of the worst hotel experiences I have had in a long time. I would expect this is I was paying £50 but that’s not what they are charging

title: Good stay
text:
The service was not as good as I would have expected and did not find it as helpful or welcoming as I would have liked.

Called ahead to book a parking space in advance and informed them I would be arriving at 12, I was told that there would be a space booked for me. On arrival the car park was very full and I could not find my reserved space (normally hotels will put a sign with my name on a space). I went to reception and it felt a little confrontational, they said that there were no spaces as guests had not left yet- so I explained that I had called ahead and had been told that I would have a space at 12.00 as I thought that she did not realise I had booked a space in advance- the response was “I can’t do anything if there is no space”. Eventually another member of staff came over and suggested that I park behind another car and give them the keys so that they could move it when a space became available and another member of staff came outside to help find a space. However the response of the first person was not great and really they should not tell you that you will be given a space if they can’t guarantee it - they are better off telling you that it’s first come first served. Normally finding another place to park would not have been an issue but we had timed entry tickets to the castle so we did not have time to be driving around Windsor trying to find a place to park. The parking is £30 which is extortionate and not justifiable

We had another bad experience in the morning when I woke to find a letter pushed through the door asking me to come to reception. I was accused of ordering things to my room without leaving my credit card details. I explained that I had left my details on arrival and on checking they realised that they had made a mistake. They told me that someone had ordered to their room without leaving details and they thought it was me. They should have checked before accusing me and asking me to visit reception, they had a file with all the credit card receipts so it was not hard to check before accusing me (and probably would have took less time than typing and sending up the letter) and I was left wondering why they had profiled me as being the person charging things to the room! It’s not nice to feel that people think you are trying to steel.

I felt the bar needed more attention with regards to COVID. For example tables were not being cleaned between customers and twice my table was dirty. Also they are providing paper menus that are shared.

Ordered room service, had a sandwich and cocktail. The sandwich was average, not worth the price and the cover charge for room service was high. I only ended up ordering room service as I did not feel confident in the cleanliness of the bar.

I had a suite and although large with separate lounge, it lacked some attention to detail. There was a rip in the side of the bedding and one of the pillows smelt. The bath is looking a bit tired.

Some of the advertised amenities had been removed due to COVID and I was not sure how to order them.

Location was good.

title: Amazing
text:
We had an amazing time at the hotel, staff were very helpful and friendly. There was no room in the hotel car park so needed to park in the public car park (very close to the hotel and secure) and they offered to park our car up when a space became available

The hotel design is fabulous and the rooms are stunning.

We booked a marina view suite and it was perfect. The bed was massive and very comfortable.

Our balcony was really spacious with wonderful marina views.

Lots of great amenities including luxury toiletries and gin!

We did not have chance to use the spa but it looked really good

We ate dinner in the hotel restaurant and was well worth the money.

title: Stunning room
text:
We booked a Deluxe Suite and had a fantastic stay. The room was bigger than the whole of my house! Massive bed and free standing bath in the room.

Luxury toiletries were provided and the rooms came with coffee maker and robes.

We loved staying in our room so much that we decided to order room service. Food was great, as was the cocktails.

They have put in really good COVID measures and was particularly impressed with them offering online access to newspapers.

Really helpful service, we called ahead to book parking and had a space reserved.

title: Wonderful experience
text:
We really loved our stay at this hotel. We booked a feature king room and it was truly wonderful.

Massive bed and lots of well thought out amenities such as Bose speaker and coffee maker.

The room and bathroom is beautifully designed and very stylish. There was a great selection of luxury toiletries.

Fantastic location and plenty of parking in a public car park next to the hotel

title: Made to feel like royalty
text:
Absolutely perfect from start to finish - they have thought of everything to make sure you have a wonderful stay.

You can arrive at noon before check in an pick up free passes to visit the castle and grounds. On check out at 10.30 you can visit the castle before it opens to the public.

We had a feature room in the Ann Boleyn wing and it was amazing. Spacious and well designed rooms with all the things you need. All the small things that hotels can often miss have been thought about, such as plugs next to the bed and mirror and good natural light.

The bathroom was fantastic, with a roll top bath and massive shower. Luxury toiletries and towels are provided.

The bed was massive with great pillows and bedding.

Due to COVID breakfast is pre-order. There is a good selection of choices and the quality is brilliant.

They have really put a lot of effort into ensuring the hotel is COVID safe and I was really impressed. They put a seal on the room so that after it’s cleaned no one but you enters the room and they put plastic screens between the tables in the dining room.

The grounds are wonderful and we really enjoyed exploring the gardens.

It’s one of the best hotels I’ve ever stayed in and I’ve booked a superior room for my birthday in November - I can’t wait to go back

title: Felt safe
text:
Popped in for a drink before my train and was impressed with how seriously they were taking COVID safety

Tables are throughly cleaned after each use and then a sign placed on table to show that it’s clean and ok to sit there

Table service and good distance between tables

title: We have been to eat in their
text:
We have been to eat in their garden twice since the lockdown restrictions were lifted and both times were perfect

Really great quality food and I loved that the cheesecake was made with rhubarb from their garden

They have put a lot of thought into their food - I’ve never had a bad meal !

The staff are great and it’s the best pub food around

title: I will start off by saying
text:
I will start off by saying that they really have put a lot of thought into keeping people safe

There is a lot of distance between tables and the have implemented a one way system as well as hand gel as you enter

All the staff have masks on and you download the menus to your phone - I really loved that idea.

The food is perfect - really high quality, sessional and full of flavour

I’m so glad to be visiting again

title: Best place to stay in London
text:
I love this hotel so much it’s such great value.

Not only is it very affordable it’s really of a high standard. The rooms are compact but have all the things you need - smart tv, coffee machine, hairdryer, ect. The towels, toiletries and bedding are good quality.

It’s really close to a tube station and what’s really good is that it’s very quiet - one of the quietist places I’ve stayed in London

The staff are great, they have a bar that sell well priced drinks

title: Fantastic hotel
text:
This is a perfect place to stay in Budapest. It’s in a good location so it’s easy to get to all the main sights.

The room was amazing, very comfortable beds a spacious lounge area and lots of amenities.

We arrived late the first night so ate in their restaurant, which I would recommend. They had live music and the food was excellent.

There is a fantastic choice at breakfast time.

title: My new favourite local
text:
Although close by I have not visited before

We got a free soup that they made with our local veg box delivery (delicious) and after taking a look at this place on their website we found that they do take away pizza & curry on Thursdays and take away Sunday lunch on a Sunday

It’s a great system - you order a few days before and pay by phone and then drive up at the allotted time and they will come out and put the food on a table for you to collect. This way we can pick up food and keep to the social distancing rules

Last Thursday we ordered pizzas (it was so good not having to cook)

The pizzas were some of the best I have ever had. The base and sauce was perfect and the toppings were plentiful and very good quality

Today we had the 3 course Sunday lunch. It’s one of the best Sunday lunches I have ever had. The beef and veg were really good quality and the gravy and Yorkshire pudding cooked to perfection

The soup starter and cheesecake desert were fabulous

The first place I will be going once the restaurants open is here - I can’t wait to try out the rest of the menu

A big thanks to this place for helping the local community with their free soups and working out a way to keep us all fed

title: grotty and overpriced
text:
although this place gets quite a few bad tripadvsor reviews I wanted to give it a go as it was mentioned my guidebook and the photos online looked stunning.

I was really disappointed and we did not spend long as we felt uncomfortable with how grimy and dirty it looked.

we purchased the basic package as we did not have a towel or the mandatory cap and flip flops. this was not good value for money as the quality of the towel and bathrobe was very poor - it was like a j-cloth! I expected better for a £45 ticket.

the ticket I had was locker room access only, its mixed sex changing rooms and there are not enough changing rooms for so many people.

the main pool looks nice but the thermal water section looked dirty. the grouting around the tiles is stained and the seating area in the thermal pool was dirty. the water has a mucky look to it.

we decided to leave after just a few minutes as it just felt too unhygienic. when we got back to the hotel we cleaned our costumes in the sink and the water was filthy.
place: St. Gellért Thermal Bath and Swimming Pool

title: Tasteless
text: Very tasteless, seemed watery. Nachos tasted cheep and a bit stale & the cheese sauce was not very cheesy tasting.

title: Good fun and good food
text:
Had a fantastic time. A really fab concept and I’ve never been anywhere like this before.

I went for the 1/2 brisket with small mac cheese. I had never eaten brisket before and did not know what it was but decided to try it as the brisket seems to be highly recommended on TA. It was a good choice, it had lots of flavour and I really enjoyed it.

I thought that it might not be filling since it dose not come with potato’s - but I was wrong it’s very filling.

It’s a very fun environment I had a great time

title: Loved it
text:
Really good quality meat in a really tasty bun. The choice of toppings is amazing, each one is different and tasty. I’ve not had anything like it before

Very good value for money if your looking for a cheep place to eat

title: Perfect
text:
By far the best fish restaurant I’ve been to, it’s more high end cost wise but absolutely worth it. The quality of the dishes is very high, the flavours are wonderful as they use very high quality fish.

The staff are helpful and attentive

title: Good customer service
text:
Very helpful staff, had a minor issue with the order and they were really professional and quickly resolved the issue.

Food was tasty and very good value

title: Loved it
text:
Came across this place by chance. It is amazing, such a wide choice of games and consoles.

The staff are super friendly and the place has a really good vibe

Prices of drinks is really reasonable.

Can’t wait to come back

title: I would not expect pho from
text:
I would not expect pho from a chain to taste authentic and I am not rating this place down for the pho not tasting authentic. The low rating is because the broth did not have much taste and I did not think it was very good. I had to add Sriracha Hot Chilli just to get some flavour.

The place may sell a version of food from Vietnam but I did not think it had the depth of flavour needed.

I also think on balance it was overpriced for what it was.

The staff that served me were pleasant.

Not too keen on the decor, more industrial than a Vietnam street food vibe.

title: So cute
text:
So cute

The cakes are works of art but not only do they look good they taste fantastic.

I had colour changing tea which was fun

It’s worth waiting for a table

title: Stunning food and very creative
text:
Stunning food and very creative

I loved everything I tried it’s very good quality.

The space is stylish and staff helpful

title: Fantastic
text:
Had a fantastic time, it’s the first time I’ve eaten Ethiopian food and the food and experience here was amazing

Had the mixed veg and meat on Injera. The mix was great and there was such a fantastic range of flavours, it was not too hot which is good for me as I don’t like a lot of heat. I’ve never had Injera, it’s lovely.

I had a glass of the honey wine, it’s sweet like a nice desert wine.

I also had the coffee ceremony, which was really interesting. The coffee was very tasty

Really good value for money

title: Fantastic stay
text:
Really good hotel, very stylish and comfy.

The size of the bedroom and bathroom is large. The room is well equipped - slippers, robe, mini-bar, iron, expresso machine, ect.

Good lighting and plenty of plug sockets. The hairdryer was good and they have a lighted mirror for doing make-up. The shower is powerful.

Very good location, directly in front of the metro and only a few stops to all the main sights, also easy to get to from the airport.

I did not feel unsafe in the area, there are lots of hotels

There is a good cafe selling pastry and cake over the road so there’s lots of options if you do not want to pay for breakfast in the hotel

Staff were friendly and helpful

The view from the rooftop bar is amazing, they also have good selection of drinks and cocktails

title: Very good collection
text:
Very good collection but the curating is a little old fashioned, which meant that I felt a little overwhelmed by all the items and could not see the wood for the trees.

I’m not sure that it’s very children friendly.

title: Nothing exceptional
text:
Nothing exceptional about the yogurt I’ve had better. The toppings were too sweet for me.

It was ok but it not worth hunting down to find, I should think most places in Athens will serve yogurt like this. Did not stand out

title: A real feast
text:
I came here because of all the good reviews on TA. To be honest I was a little apprehensive when I arrived as it was in a tourist spot and there was someone outside encouraging people to look at the menu - which I always associate with being a tourist trap.

I was very wrong about my first impressions - this place really deserves all it great reviews !

Our waiter was fantastic - friendly, attentive and helpful. He was great and really made us feel welcome

I just don’t know what to say about the food!!!!

We had the Tzatziki, smoked aubergine and split pea dip to start - so fantastic

For our main we had the Greek platter for 2 - and WOW it’s amazing. It included the best musaka I’ve ever had, roasted lamb with vegetables, strips of chicken, feta baked with tomato and vegetables stuffed with orzo

Every dish was superb

We had so much fun trying all the dishes, it was a great night

title: Wow
text:
I have been wanting to go for years. This place was magical. December seems to be a good time to go as it’s not too hot.

Although the weather is not hot I would recommend taking some water

title: Fantastic place for breakfast
text:
Fantastic place for breakfast or lunch. They have a wide variety to choose from.

Service was friendly

We came for breakfast and had really good pastry’s. The cakes look amazing

title: Absolutely fantastic food
text:
Absolutely fantastic food and really nice menu - my photos don’t do it justice,

Staff were really helpful and gave great suggestions for fishes to try.

Portion sizes are very generous

Good quality is excellent and so tasty.

2 starters, 2 mains, 1 desert, water, glass of wine and 2 coffee for under €50!

title: Fantastic airport hotel
text:
Really good location directly across the airport and next to the long stay car park.

Really quite and comfy rooms you would not know you were so close to an airport

Breakfast starts at 4 so really good for early flights

title: Good honest pub food
text:
First time I have been since a bad experience 18 months ago (to be fair the manager did reach out to us after my poor review and offer us another meal)

I had the weekday lunch menu and was impressed with the value for money. Good selection of traditional pub classics and large portions.

Staff were attentive

Very clean and nice traditional pub feel

Wine was good quality.

It’s absolutely what you want in pub food

title: Best mid range hotel in London
text:
We will alway use this hotel when in London.

It’s everything you could want from a midrange price hotel.

Location is excellent - just over the road from a central line tube station.

Decor is trendy, fresh and modern.

The quality is exceptional. Fantastic beds and pillows. The towels were really fluffy and big and they had high quality toiletries.

Extremely good shower and lighted mirror which was good for makeup

The rooms were stylish and practical - little things like having plugs next to a mirror is really important but a lot of hotels don’t have this

I think it is the cleanest hotel I have ever visited. The bathroom was pristine with no mould.

The staff were friendly

We did not have breakfast but will get it next time. There was a good choice and it looked good quality
